intro: Pedicularis rohtangensis, commonly known as the Rohtang Beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking purple or pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are often hairy and robust. Pedicularis rohtangensis is a rare and endemic species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
